A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: ******spoilers***** If you are TRULY a fan\, don't expect much. There were a couple quick sequences that could have been worthwhile\, but each falls short just as something is about to happen. Rian Johnson failed to make any meaningful connections to characters and plotlines were predictable. Almost no character development and character's storylines/backgrounds (snoke\, rey\, etc.) are left untouched. The humor in this film is hard to watch\, as it comes of forced and out of place. Kylo Ren fails to commit to the dark side and is left looking like a pushover. Rey is given convenient power ups with 0 training and is now supposed to be some Jedi wizard. Mark hamill made the best of the subpar script he was given\, but still couldn't fix the movie. Enough said . . . I just honestly have no clue how this received 93% for critic reviews.
